author: Skybeat
body:
Hello,

I was trying a script from PS 5.1 where i use the cmdlet `Get-Counter`.
If I try this script with PS 6.2.3 the follow error message is shown:

> get-counter : The term 'get-counter' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.

# Steps to reproduce

fire a `Get-Counter` in powershell



# Expected behavior

that it works


# Actual behavior

the error message: 

> get-counter : The term 'get-counter' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.



# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->


PSVersion                      6.2.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


Thank you,
Nico
title: Get-Counter is not in PowerShell Core
